data.title: Queens
data.statement:
You are given a 8x8 chessboard with some queens placed on it.
You must output the board with all the positions where ONE additional queen may be placed without threatening the existing ones or being threatened by one

As a reminder, a queen threatens all squares in the eight surrounding directions - left, right, up, down and the four diagonals.
data.inputDescription:
8 lines of 8 chars
A dot (.) represents an empty square, a Q represents a queen.
data.outputDescription:
8 lines of 8 chars
A dot (.) represents an empty square, a P represents a position where a new queen may be placed. The squares of the original queens must be left empty.

lastVersion.statementHTML:
The program:
You are given a 8x8 chessboard with some queens placed on it.
You must output the board with all the positions where ONE additional queen may be placed without threatening the existing ones or being threatened by one

As a reminder, a queen threatens all squares in the eight surrounding directions - left, right, up, down and the four diagonals.
INPUT:
8 lines of 8 chars
A dot (.) represents an empty square, a Q represents a queen.

OUTPUT:
8 lines of 8 chars
A dot (.) represents an empty square, a P represents a position where a new queen may be placed. The squares of the original queens must be left empty.

EXAMPLE:
Input
........
........
........
...Q....
........
........
........
........
Output
.PP.PP.P
P.P.P.PP
PP...PPP
........
PP...PPP
P.P.P.PP
.PP.PP.P
PPP.PPP.
